entry.title: Re: Invoicing in SAP Ariba
entry.content:
Hello Abhinay,

Thanks for your kind words.
Regarding your query, as per my understanding, it should be possible to calculate withholding tax in Ariba B&I with tax related configuration. Request you to refer below pointers and links, give it a try and confirm back.

Withholding taxes(WHT) are not included in the invoice amount payable to the supplier. Buyers are responsible to pay withholding taxes directly to the government. Ariba Buying and Invoicing supports withholding tax at both header and line levels. Withholding taxes can only be applied on invoices and invoice reconciliation documents. By default, the WHT is calculated based on NetAmount.

Related Links:

  •  Why is the withholding tax not updated on Payable to Supplier in the Invoice Reconciliation?
  •  How do I make the Taxable Total on the withholding tax exceptions editable?
  •  What is Ariba Network’s approach to withholding tax?
  •  Import Input Tax Code and Withholding Tax Code Master Data

entry.title: Batches in quality inspection are selected in outbound deliveries
entry.content:
Why stock in Quality Inspection was confirmed by the orders while the Availability Check is set to do not consider Quality Inspection stock?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Batches in quality inspection are selected in outboun...
entry.content:
During sales order processing, the ATP check follows the defined scope of check, which excludes Quality Inspection stock if configured that way.

However, during delivery creation, the system performs batch determination instead of an ATP check. Batch determination follows its own strategy and selection criteria (search strategy, class, and characteristics).

If the batch search strategy does not explicitly exclude Quality Inspection stock, the system may still propose such batches at delivery stage, even though they were not considered during ATP.

In summary, the reason Quality Inspection batches can be selected is that ATP rules govern sales order confirmation, while delivery batch determination follows a separate customizing logic. Unless the batch selection strategy explicitly filters out QI stock, these batches may still appear.

entry.title: Re: Agent Assignment at one shot without RHMOVE30 before starting First Workflow in System
entry.content:
Warning: I reply to a message posted a long time ago (2014).

@I042439 You are saying that you can't change the workflow customizing in QA or PRD if you define TRSP CORR = empty (with transport requests), because QA and PRD are defined as "customizing not modifiable" (transaction code SCC0). If I understand well, you are also saying that with TRSP CORR = empty in QA or PRD, you could change the workflow customizing. So, you could make TRSP CORR = space (automatic transports) in DEV, and = "X" (no transports) in other systems. Wouldn't that work?

NB: link to the SAP note: 1416609 - PD Object can be changed although changes are not allowed - SAP for Me. Just to make it clear, it says:

« The entry TRSP CORR X in the table T77S0 is set as
' ' (Blank) = automatic transport connection is activated

The table T000 has 'Changes and transports for Client-Specific Objects' sets as 'No changes allowed'
This flag means that changes in the customizing settings of the client are not permitted (client lock).

The settings of the tables T77s0 and T000 are contradictory. »

entry.title: Re: Moregraph: Metadata-driven Enterprise Architecture using Conceptual Structures
entry.content:
Really interesting work! I see Moregraph as a practical bridge between business strategy and data reality. A few thoughts:

Metadata as a strategic enabler – it’s not just documentation; it actively drives enterprise architecture decisions and helps reduce technical debt.

Breaking application silos – visualizing data objects beyond app boundaries is powerful for uncovering hidden relationships and improving integration rationalization.

Clean core & extensibility – using SAP Graph to maintain granular, clean-core data objects opens real opportunities for API rationalization and sustainable EA evolution.

Overall, it’s a compelling approach to making EA metadata-driven, actionable, and measurable. Excited to see how this evolves in practice!

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA for Group Reporting - Introducing New Rules for Automatic Postings
entry.content:
Hi Robert,

Yes, this feature, namely "Variable", is planned for Q4.2025, please see https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?BC=6EAE8B27FCC11ED892E919ED096400CC&range=CURRENT-LAST#;INNO=0D82B68955E41EEFBAAA2BD4AD397247

With the variable you can read one (or more) sets of data in addition to the source data, and use them when you define calculation formula, to calculate, for example:

  • earnings per share 
  • direct owership percentage
  • inventory profit
  • deferred tax
  • non controlling interest

I plan to write a blog to describe this feature once it is released, stay tuned!

Best regards,

Grégoire

entry.title: Search Bar + Autocomplete + Fuzzy Search (OData via BTP Destination) in SAP Build App
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am new to SAP Build Apps and I need help. I want to create a search bar in my app that:

  • connects to an OData entity using BTP Destination,

  • shows a list of suggestions (autocomplete) on the same page,

  • and supports fuzzy search.

For example: if I type *sap*, it should return all records that contain “sap” in the relevant fields.

What I tried: I followed the SAP blog/video 'No-code Power-up: Search bar with autocomplete suggestions /w AppGyver', but it doesn’t meet my needs. I could fetch the entire entity into a data variable and filter locally, but that’s not possible for large datasets (e.g. Purchase Orders) — I don’t want to load all records in one call.

So I want server-side filtering: when the user types, the app should query the OData service with a filter and return matched records (paged, limited). The suggestions must appear on the same page in real time (but without preloading everything).

Could anyone explain, step-by-step, how to implement this in SAP Build Apps (AppGyver) with BTP Destination? If you have exact filter examples, recommended debounce/limits, or a working flow, please share. Thank you!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: O que é o SAP Datasphere?
entry.content:
Introdução

O SAP Datasphere é a solução mais recente da SAP para gestão de dados corporativos, criada para habilitar uma arquitetura de business data fabric. Essa arquitetura permite harmonizar dados críticos de negócios em toda a organização, ajudando empresas a tomar decisões mais rápidas e precisas.

O Contexto de Negócio

Compreender o contexto de negócio no SAP Datasphere é fundamental para aproveitar seu potencial. Seja você arquiteto de soluções, engenheiro de dados ou analista, esta plataforma oferece recursos que simplificam a integração, governança e consumo de dados em escala.

O que é o SAP Datasphere?

O SAP Datasphere reúne em um único serviço recursos antes separados, como:

  • Integração de dados
  • Catalogação
  • Modelagem semântica
  • Data warehousing

A solução foi desenhada para combinar federation e ingestion de dados SAP e não-SAP, preservando o contexto e o significado dos dados, independentemente do sistema ou nuvem em que se encontram. Isso elimina a necessidade de replicar dados em mais um repositório, simplificando a landscape de dados e garantindo governança desde a origem até o consumo.

Evolução: Do SAP Data Warehouse Cloud ao SAP Datasphere

Em 2019, a SAP lançou o SAP Data Warehouse Cloud, primeira solução de data warehousing totalmente em nuvem. Já em 2023, foi apresentado o SAP Datasphere, sucessor lógico que adiciona recursos avançados de integração e catalogação de dados.

O SAP Datasphere foi projetado para colaborar com ferramentas externas, como:

  • Collibra – Governança e catalogação de dados
  • Databricks – Integração com Data Lakehouse para machine learning
  • Confluent – Streaming e eventos em tempo real
  • DataRobot – Inteligência aumentada com AutoML
  • Google Cloud – Integração completa com BigQuery e AI para criar um data cloud de ponta a ponta

Essa abordagem reforça a estratégia de abertura e interoperabilidade, permitindo que empresas aproveitem ao máximo seus investimentos já existentes em dados.

Arquitetura do SAP Datasphere

A arquitetura combina:

  • Funcionalidades de banco de dados (SAP HANA Cloud)
  • Modelagem de dados com ferramentas low-code/no-code
  • Integração nativa com o SAP Analytics Cloud para relatórios e planejamento

Os principais blocos funcionais são:

  • Space Management – Criação e monitoramento de espaços seguros para modelagem de dados
  • Data Integration e Data Flow – Conexão com fontes SAP e não-SAP, replicação em tempo real e transformações
  • Data Builder – Modelagem técnica e harmonização de dados
  • Data Catalog – Organização e governança de metadados para promover confiança e reutilização
  • Data Marketplace – Integração simples com dados de terceiros
  • Administração e Segurança – Controle de acessos, auditoria e conformidade
  • Semantic Onboarding – Importação de objetos semânticos de sistemas SAP e marketplaces
  • Consumo – Conexão com SAP Analytics Cloud ou outras ferramentas de BI via SQL ou APIs

Benefícios para Empresas

Com o SAP Datasphere, organizações conseguem:

  • Reduzir complexidade da landscape de dados
  • Preservar o contexto de informações críticas
  • Garantir governança em todas as etapas do ciclo de vida dos dados
  • Integrar e consumir dados em tempo real
  • Facilitar o autosserviço de modelagem para usuários de negócio

Conclusão

O SAP Datasphere é mais que uma evolução do SAP Data Warehouse Cloud – é uma plataforma completa para integração, governança e consumo de dados, projetada para um mundo multicloud e multisource.

Ele oferece às empresas uma base sólida para transformar dados em vantagem competitiva, combinando simplicidade, escalabilidade e flexibilidade para atender desde necessidades operacionais até iniciativas estratégicas de análise e planejamento.

entry.title: Re: Extract G/L account line items via API with OAuth2.0...
entry.content:
Hi @andre_westra67 

I recommend exploring KBA 3395176. Yes, you are correct. The reason you do not see SAP_COM_0536 in your system is that the relevant scope item is not active which is delivered with scope item 2Q2. If it is not in your scope, then the communication arrangement will not be in your system. You can verify this in Manage Your Solution by searching for the scope item 2Q2. If it is missing, your implementation partner or SAP can activate it for you.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: A cross application Fiori APP to print Adobe Forms
entry.content: Enhanced the filter for PDF Version to show only versions relevant to the chosen Application Type (or Transaction). It also shows the Content ADOBE form and Master ADOBE form associated with the versions. Please see the attached CDS View (ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V4) for this changes.

entry.title: Re: A cross application Fiori APP to print Adobe Forms
entry.content:
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Object information for ADOBE PDF'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true
@OData.publish: true

define view entity ZCDS_OBJECT_PDF_V4

  with parameters
    @Consumption.defaultValue : 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Appllication Type'
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition:                    // Annotation to link parameter with CDS view which will help to generate Text
    [ {
        entity: { name: 'ZCDS_ZDCP_FP_PDF_FORM',
                  element: 'iv_object_type'}
      }]
    p1_iv_object_type : apoc_appl_object_type,
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '001'

    @EndUserText.label: 'PDF Version(1(CUSTOM), 2(SAP)..etc'
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition:                    // Annotation to link parameter with CDS view which will help to generate Text
    [ {
        entity: { name: 'ZPDF_VERSION_VH',
                  element: 'iv_version_nr'},
                  additionalBinding: [{ localParameter: 'p1_iv_object_type', element: 'iv_object_type' }]
      }]
    p2_iv_version_nr  : /accgo/e_ovd_version,
    //@Environment.systemField: #SYSTEM_DATE
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '2025'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Fiscal year'

    p3_iv_fyear       : /accgo/e_fiscal_year,
    @Consumption.defaultValue : '1730'
    @EndUserText.label: 'Company Code'
    //I_CompanyCodeStdVH
    @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition:                    // Annotation to link parameter with CDS view which will help to generate Text
    [ {
        entity: { name: 'I_CompanyCodeStdVH',
                  element: 'CompanyCode'}
      }]
    p4_iv_cc          : /accgo/e_companycode_vh

  as select from    zfp_pdf_form           as objtype


    left outer join I_PurchaseOrder        as po                 on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
                                                                 and po.CompanyCode         = $parameters.p4_iv_cc
  // and po.mandt = $session.client

    left outer join I_PurchaseContract     as pc                 on  objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT'
                                                                 and pc.CompanyCode         = $parameters.p4_iv_cc

    left outer join I_BillingDocument      as bill               on  objtype.iv_object_type   = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'
                                                                 and bill.BillingDocumentType = 'F2'
                                                                 and bill.CompanyCode         = $parameters.p4_iv_cc
                                                                 and (
                                                                    (
                                                                      bill.FiscalYear         = $parameters.p3_iv_fyear
                                                                    )
                                                                    or(
                                                                      bill.FiscalYear         = '0000'
                                                                    )
                                                                  )
    left outer join I_BillingDocument      as bill_cm            on  objtype.iv_object_type      = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT_CM'
                                                                 and bill_cm.BillingDocumentType = 'G2'
                                                                 and bill_cm.CompanyCode         = $parameters.p4_iv_cc
                                                                 and (
                                                                    (
                                                                      bill_cm.FiscalYear         = $parameters.p3_iv_fyear
                                                                    )
                                                                    or(
                                                                      bill_cm.FiscalYear         = '0000'
                                                                    )
                                                                  )
    left outer join I_SupplierInvoiceAPI01 as supp_inv_complaint on  objtype.iv_object_type        = 'COMPLAINT'
                                                                 and not(
      supp_inv_complaint.SuplrInvcAutomReducedAmount                                               = 0
      and supp_inv_complaint.SuplrInvcManuallyReducedAmount                                        = 0
    )
                                                                 and supp_inv_complaint.FiscalYear = $parameters.p3_iv_fyear

    left outer join I_SalesContract        as sales_con          on  objtype.iv_object_type       = 'SALES_CONTRACT'
                                                                 and sales_con.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc

    left outer join I_SalesOrder           as ord_conf           on  objtype.iv_object_type      = 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION'
                                                                 and ord_conf.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc


    left outer join I_SalesQuotation       as sales_quot         on  objtype.iv_object_type        = 'SALES_QUOTATION'
                                                                 and sales_quot.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc
  //CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST
    left outer join I_CreditMemoRequest    as cred_memo          on  objtype.iv_object_type       = 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST'
                                                                 and cred_memo.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc

  //DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST
    left outer join I_DebitMemoRequest     as debit_memo         on  objtype.iv_object_type        = 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST'
                                                                 and debit_memo.BillingCompanyCode = $parameters.p4_iv_cc

  // association [0..1] to I_OutputControlApplObjectType as _ObjType on $projection.iv_object_type = _ObjType.OutputControlApplObjectType
{

      //I_PurchaseOrder
      @ui.lineItem: [ {
      position: 10
      } ]
      // @ui.selectionField: [{position: 10 }]
      // @Consumption.filter.defaultValue: 'PURCHASE_ORDER'
      @EndUserText.label: 'Appllication Type'

      //   @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_ObjType'
  key objtype.iv_object_type as iv_object_type,
      @ui.lineItem: [ {
      position: 20
      } ]
      @ui.selectionField: [{position: 20 }]

      @EndUserText.label: 'Document Number'
  key
      case
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_ORDER' then po.PurchaseOrder
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT' then pc.PurchaseContract
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT' then bill.BillingDocument
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT_CM' then bill_cm.BillingDocument
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_CONTRACT' then sales_con.SalesContract
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'ORDER_CONFIRMATION' then ord_conf.SalesOrder
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'SALES_QUOTATION' then sales_quot.SalesQuotation
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'CREDIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then cred_memo.CreditMemoRequest
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'DEBIT_MEMO_REQUEST' then debit_memo.DebitMemoRequest
      //supp_inv_complaint.SupplierInvoiceWthnFiscalYear for 'COMPLAINT'
      when objtype.iv_object_type = 'COMPLAINT' then supp_inv_complaint.SupplierInvoiceWthnFiscalYear
      else 'Under Construction'
      end                    as iv_object_nr,
      @ui.lineItem: [{ type: #WITH_URL , url: 'valueLink',  position: 30}]
      @EndUserText.label: 'PDF'
      // @ui.statusInfo: [{criticality: ''}]
      'Download PDF->|'      as showPdf,

      case
           when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_ORDER' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',po.PurchaseOrder), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', po.CompanyCode),''')/$value'))))))
           when objtype.iv_object_type = 'PURCHASE_CONTRACT' then
           concat('/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_PDF_CROSS_APP2_SRV/get_pdfSet(',concat(concat('IvObjectType=''', objtype.iv_object_type), concat(concat(''',IvVersionNr=''',objtype.iv_version_nr),concat(concat(''',IvObjectNr=''',pc.PurchaseContract), concat(concat(''',IvFyear=''',$parameters.p3_iv_fyear),concat(concat(''',IvCc=''', pc.CompanyCode),''')/$value'))))))
            when objtype.iv_object_type = 'BILLING_DOCUMENT'  then

entry.title: Program RHTTCP77 to fix some errors in SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables"
entry.content:
In this blog post, we'll see the program RHTTCP77 which can fix some of the errors in the SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables".

There's also the program RHSOBJCH which can fix other errors, and is presented in this other blog post: Program RHSOBJCH to fix some errors in SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" - SAP Community.

That said, let's see the program RHTTCP77 now.

The transaction SWU3 is used to configure SAP Business Workflow. All the activities should be green.

But it's very frequent to have some SAP internal errors in the activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" (red cross):

Execute the activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" to see the errors:

The program RHTTCP77 cannot fix the above errors but it can fix the below errors:

Run the program RHTTCP77 in test mode to see what data could be copied from the default configuration stored in the client 000:

Too many updates here for just 2 errors concerning the table T777I ...

So, let's run again RHTTCP77 to filter to the only problem concerning T777I:

Let's see the new and changed entries in T777I (NB: here, we're still in the test mode):

Now that you have seen the impacts, you may run RHTTCP77 in real mode, by switching off the test mode:

Back to SWU3, it's now green:

Congratulations, you did it !

NB: the SAP note 3329771 - 'Check Entries from HR Control Tables' in SWU3 fails with error 'Not an entry in table SOBJ' - SAP for Me is of no interest, it just repeats to run the programs RHTTCP77 and RHSOBJCH.

There's also the SAP note 2366252 - Transaction SWU3 explained - SAP for Me, which again is of no interest because it repeats the documentation displayed inline in SWU3. Or did I miss something?

entry.title: Program RHSOBJCH to fix some errors in SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables"
entry.content:
In this blog post, we'll see the program RHSOBJCH which can fix some of the errors in the SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables".

There's also the program RHTTCP77 which can fix other errors, which is presented in this blog post: Program RHTTCP77 to fix some errors in SWU3 activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" - SAP Community.

That said, let's see the program RHSOBJCH now.

The transaction SWU3 is used to configure SAP Business Workflow. All the activities should be green.

But it's very frequent to have some SAP internal errors in the activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" (red cross):

Execute the activity "Check Entries from HR Control Tables" to see the errors:

There's no risk to fix the data in the transaction SOBJ by the standard program RHSOBJCH.

The SWU3 information text (first screenshot) talks about PDST or PDWS but it can also concern PDST_BASE or PDWS_BASE in recent ABAP versions (test with ABAP 7.58), as you can see if you run RHSOBJCH (for information, it doesn't update anything if you don't press Adjust):

All the entries above are missing in the transaction SOBJ.

Here's the content of transaction SOBJ, concerning the Piece List of object PDST_BASE, before and after running the program RHSOBJCH:

  1. Before running RHSOBJCH, we can see these tables in the Piece List of SOBJ:
  2. After running "Adjust" in RHSOBJCH:


    We can now see these new tables in the Piece List inserted by RHSOBJCH:

Congratulations, you did it !

NB: the SAP note 3329771 - 'Check Entries from HR Control Tables' in SWU3 fails with error 'Not an entry in table SOBJ' - SAP for Me is of no interest, it just repeats to run the programs RHTTCP77 and RHSOBJCH.

There's also the SAP note 2366252 - Transaction SWU3 explained - SAP for Me, which again is of no interest because it repeats the documentation displayed inline in SWU3. Or did I miss something?

entry.title: Re: Client Certificate Authentication in SAP Cloud Integration: Configuration and Best Practices
entry.content:
Hi @BishalDeb 

Apologies for the late response.

Q:What i understood is keytype "External Certificate" should be chosen when Client gives us the certificate from their side.

A: Yes that is correct.

Q:Additionally, in HTTPS Adapter, we need to change the auth from user role to Client certificate and upload the root certificate which client will provide.

A: Not necessarily, the exact same steps can be taken with the option "External Certificate", as with our example of creating the Certificate in the BTP Cockpit.

When you are creating the Service Instance, you can specify the Role the same way, and it will be associated with the uploaded External certificate.

Q:Additionally, assumption would be that the same certificate will be already added in client's SAP system using STRUST.
If not then they should create new Client PSE and then import their own certificate along with the Load balancer certificates which we downloaded from Cloud Integration.

And then we create RFC with the required host and path and then choose the appropriate SSL certificate from the dropdown.

A: Yes, that is completely correct.

Best Regards,
Adam

entry.title: Re: Sunset of BEx Tools - Frequently Asked Questions and Answers (FAQ)
entry.content:
Hi Tanuj - 

While standard BEx Analyzer workbooks using standard BEx queries can be transitioned to Analysis for Office (AO),

However, BEX planning-enabled workbooks present a more complex challenge. These rely heavily on Integrated Planning features such as real-time cubes, input-ready BEx queries, and planning functions—all of which are tightly coupled with our current NetWeaver 7.5 architecture.

Can Analysis for Office replicate the functionality of planning-enabled BEx Analyzer workbooks within the current NW7.5 architecture?

Our concern is SAP’s roadmap continues to shift. We initially evaluated BPC as a successor, but during that process, SAP introduced SAC Planning and Data Warehouse Cloud (DWC). Now, with the emergence of Business Data Cloud (BDC), the landscape has become even more fragmented. These frequent changes make it difficult to commit to a long-term platform, as each new solution introduces fresh integration challenges and strategic uncertainty.

 

Thanks,

Vijay

entry.title: Re: SAP GUI version is compatible for this new released M...
entry.content:
Hello customer,

As per your request please refer to SAP Note 3485708 - SAP GUI for Java 8.10 Requirements:

Software

  • The embedded SapMachine 21 is used.
  • macOS Sonoma 14, see SAP Note 3385617 for details.
  • macOS Sequoia 15.2 and newer, see SAP Note 3517261 for details.
  • macOS 26 (Tahoe) is still under testing, see SAP Note 3656940 for details.

SAP is currently in the process of running acceptance tests on macOS 26 (Tahoe).

It is not recommended to use SAP GUI for Java on macOS 26 (Tahoe) until these tests are concluded.

SAP Note 3485708 will be updated once macOS 26 (Tahoe) is finally supported.

 

Keep in mind, the SAP GUI for Java 8.10 is the only available and supported version.  Older Releases are no longer supported, for support deadline, see note 147519.

Best Regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Crystal Reports Runtime Memory error
entry.content:
We recently upgraded from Crystal Reports Runtime SP27 to SP37.  We then started receiving this error.  We run a service that processes reports and has threading.  We get it randomly and pretty frequently.  We did not get this error at all previously.  We have additionally tried uninstalling and reinstalling SP27 but we now still get the same error.  Rolling back to a server that never got SP37 does not experience the problem..  Was there a major change in SP37 that would have changed files we can't roll back?  Anybody experiencing this?

System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x80041004): Not enough memory for operation.
at CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.Controllers.SubreportControllerClass.GetSubreport(String Name)at CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.ReportDocument.GetSubreport(String subreportName)at CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.Subreports..ctor(ReportDocument doc)at CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.ReportDocument.get_Subreports()

entry.title: Re: Templates for Stories in People Analytics
entry.content:
Hi @mitsutani ,

Thank you for your query. The templates available in Content Store are different from the "Save as Template" option. Please note that the "Save as Template" option is useful when there is a standard format of the Story UI look and feel needed to be re-used in that system, like a particular layout or images. It does not store the query and also removes the data sources and stores a blank template.

The reports available in Content Store are complete stories (you can relate them to the .package export). They contain complete story definition with data source(s). SAP releases them and currently the only ones who can add/update them to be available in Content Store.

Partners/Customers can also create their own standard version of reports and use the local import/export functionality to share them with other tenants, but they do not fall under the purview of the content available in Content Store and will be supported as custom content.

Hope this clarifies your query. 

Best Regards

Ayon

entry.title: Re: manager can create goals even if the goal plan is on...
entry.content:
Hello @user116,

Although the state is Locked, it is possible that the permissions in the Goal Plan XML are configured differently. Please review your goal plan template in Provisioning and see if this state has the following example configuration:

<permission for="create">
	<description> Employees and their managers can create goals. </description>
	<role-name>E</role-name>
	<role-name>EM</role-name> 
</permission>

You can also review the help guide linked below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-performance-and-goals/implementing-and-managing-goal-management/action-permissions?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

entry.title: CFDi: Separar clave SAT para horas extras y descanso laborado PY-MX
entry.content:
Saludos,

El caso planteado por cliente es que las horas extras se deben reflejar en clave SAT 019 y el descanso el clave SAT 038.

entry.title: Re: Incorrect Business Partner ID
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

I hope you are well. 

For companies, the corresponding business partner ID is determined as below:

1. If the business partner ID is provided in the Internal Business Partner ID field of the org unit at the time of creation, then upon activation, that ID will be used.
2. If there is no business partner ID specified, then the org unit ID will be taken, as long as the org unit ID's length is ≤ 10 characters (and the org unit ID in question is within an External number range maintained in the General Business Partners fine-tuning activity of the Business Configuration).
3. If all of the above criteria are not met, then the business partner ID will be taken from the Internal automatic number range maintained in the General Business Partners fine-tuning activity of the Business Configuration.
The Business Partner ID cannot be changed afterwards.

1694086 - Business Partners Generated for Companies Do Not Always Have the Same ID As Org Unit ID
https://me.sap.com/notes/1694086

In case you have any further questions or issues, please reach out to me and I'll be glad to help. 

Have a great day!  

Best regards, 

Tiago 
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud - Adobe Forms: Extend data source and layout
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for responding so quickly.

I understand that the nature of the S4 Public Cloud is to limit access to the backend and follow standardized processes using SAP best practices. I fully agree with this Cloud philosophy.

However, in my opinion, allowing the customer to fully customize their print forms is not a modification to the standard processes. The customer's requirement is simply to be able to create a custom layout of their form, grouping items by material group, and display other data in the form that is stored in SAP, in standard processes, but not provided by the standard form data source. This is why I mentioned that it's not necessary to create custom fields in the database; simply that there is a way to access this data (via CDS) and be able to extend the data source to display it in the form.

Therefore, to confirm this point, could you confirm that these types of extensions and customizations cannot be done in the S4 Public Cloud? That way, I could speak to the customer and let them know.

Thanks in advance. 

Kind Regards.

entry.title: Using Document AI Premium in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Intro

SAP Document AI, previously known as Document Information Extraction or DOX, has been bundled in SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA) for many years. The bundled document extraction capabilities in SBPA are leveraging Document AI Base edition based on Machine Learning. Since the introduction of the LLM-based Document AI Premium, there are many cases where the Premium version is the best and prefered option, or you may want to combine both versions. Although SAP Document AI Premium can be connected to SBPA via API like any other BTP service, this still poses a challenge for many SBPA users, who expect a no-code activity similar to the bundled version (DOX SDK).
In this blog post, I will explain how to quickly leverage Document AI Premium in your process automation projects using a reusable package that we deploy in our proof-of-concept activities.

Prerequisites

The assumption is that you have a Document AI Premium service and destination configured on your SBPA subaccount. If not, please check the quick setup tips below and find detailed instructions in SAP Help:

  • Document AI Premium service: You should setup Document AI Premium in your BTP environment (can be on any subbacount).
    For CloudFoundry, easiest way is to use booster.
  • Destination: You should create a destionation, with all required additonal properties for SBPA, in the subbacount where you SAP Build Process Automation is activated and add it to your Build tenant. Easiest way to create a destionation is to download this example and import into your BTP cockpit. You should update 4 parameters (Client ID, Client Secret, Token Service URL and URL) with values from your Document AI Service key.  

Easiest way to start

I will first cover the simplest way to get started with Document AI Premium in your automation process, which will work for most users. The goal is to quickly enable the capability to add an activity that will synchronously call your Document AI Premium. 

You need to download the latest version of the reusable DocAI Premium package from this link (MTAR file) and import it into your SAP Build Lobby:

Once the reusable package is uploaded, go to "versions" and select "Publish to Library". Once published, the package will be available to all developers on this tenant.

Open or create an automation project and add this package as a dependency (very similar to the way you add standard SBPA SDK packages):

 

Now you have the reusable automation 'DocAI - Extract with Schema' in your project, which you can simply drag and drop into your automation flow. You can ignore the other automations for now, as they are meant for advanced cases that I will cover separately. For most users, they are not relevant.

There are 2 input parameters: "fileToUpload" and "schemaName".

"File to upload" is self-explanatory; just provide a local path to a document that you want to process with the Document AI Premium service. "Schema name" refers to any SAP standard or custom schema that is created in your Document AI Premium. Make sure to use the exact name of any standard or custom schema.

And that's it. Once you run your autmation, there will be 3 output parameters that you can use:

  • fullResponse: Exact full output from the Document AI service (e.g., confidence level, page, coordinates, etc.)
  • extractedData:Simplified response with only the header and line items fields of your schema. This output is useful if you just want to map extracted data to your Action call, any API or BAPI call, or quickly map exact schema key values.
  • Status: Status of the extracted document. This field is here for simplification. The status is anyway returned in the fullResponse.status where you can also find additional details if there is a failure. For example, the document may have a valid extension but is corrupted, which will result in a "FAILED" status. To handle this, you can add IF logic after extraction and simply check if the Status == "FAILED" and then take appropriate action.

You can see the difference between the two output responses in the example below:

Notes for advanced automation users

You can double-click on the automation "DocAI - Extract with Schema" and see how this automation works. You will notice that it's uploading the document and waiting for the Document AI Premium service response. You can use the upload automation to send a document to the service, and then start a process that will wait for the service response and continue with the process flow. This asynchronous approach will help you process many more documents with one unattended connection compared to the typical synchronous automation. I will cover this in a separate post, but here is the concept:

You can also activate or deactivate the Instant Learning capability of your Document AI Premium with the automations provided in the package. There is no need to deploy anything. Just add the automations to an empty project and run them in test mode.

For those of you who are familiar with reusable packages (Library) and understand the implications of deploying a new version of your own, here is the editable version of this package so you can adjust it for your specific needs. I don’t advise doing that if you are not familiar with Library concepts and all implications of import and export activities.

Conclusion

I hope this package will speed up and simplify your automation projects with Document AI Premium. Package supports both Windows and Mac OS desktop agents. Let me know how it works for you in the comments below. 

I plan to cover the following topics in upcoming posts:

  • Example automation projects that are leveraging this package
  • Asynchronous approach for faster processing of large volumes of documents
  • How to combine new Document AI Workspaces with SAP Build Process Automation

Also, feel free to ask if you want me to cover other topics or if you would like to know more about SAP Document AI Premium combined with SAP Build Process Automation.

entry.title: Re: CAP Java: CSV data in the test/data folder not loaded...
entry.content:
Data has been loaded by adding the following configuration to the default profile:

  dataSource.csv.paths:
    - ../test/data/**

 Here is the overall configuration of the application.yaml.

---
spring:
  config.activate.on-profile: default
  sql.init.platform: h2
cds:
  data-source.auto-config.enabled: false
  dataSource.csv.paths:
    - ../test/data/**

entry.title: Get Certified in SAP Sales Cloud V2 - A prep live session series starting Oct 7th 2025
entry.content:
Are you ready to take your career in sales technology to the next level? Do you want to become a go-to expert in implementing one of the most innovative sales solutions on the market? Then mark your calendars!

SAP Learning is thrilled to announce another 6 part live session series starting Oct 7th designed to help you ace the SAP Certified Associate - Implementation Consultant - SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 exam!

Click here to explore the full series and register

Why SAP Sales Cloud Version 2?

In today's fast-paced sales environment, businesses need more than just basic CRM. SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 is a game-changer, empowering sales teams with:

  • AI and Machine Learning: Predictive analytics, intelligent recommendations, and automated insights to help reps prioritize leads and close deals faster.
  • Seamless Integration: Connects effortlessly with the broader SAP ecosystem (ERP, S/4HANA, etc.) for a truly end-to-end business process.
  • Modern User Experience: Intuitive, mobile-first design built on SAP Fiori for enhanced usability and adoption.
  • Flexibility & Extensibility: Low-code/no-code options and an API-first approach for easy customization and integration.

This isn't just about managing customer data; it's about driving intelligent engagement and accelerating business growth. As more companies adopt this powerful solution, the demand for skilled implementation consultants is skyrocketing.

Why Get Certified?

Earning your "SAP Certified Associate - Implementation Consultant - SAP Sales Cloud Version 2" certification demonstrates your foundational knowledge and in-depth skills in implementing and administering this cutting-edge solution. It validates that you:

  • Possess a comprehensive understanding of SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 fundamentals.
  • Can actively participate in project teams focusing on Sales Cloud V2 implementations in a mentored role.
  • Are equipped to configure key sales-specific capabilities, manage master data, and understand extensibility options.
  • Understand critical areas like Lead and Opportunity Management, Activities Management, Mobile App capabilities, and the integration of Machine Learning and Generative AI.

This certification is your badge of excellence, differentiating you in the job market and opening doors to exciting career opportunities!

What You'll Get from These Live Sessions:

This exclusive series of live sessions, led by an SAP expert, is quite simply your best shot at prepping for success. You'll walk away with:

  • Comprehensive Coverage: This is a 6-part live session series, each about an hour long, designed to take you through the entire content of the learning journeys.
  • Deep Dives: Expert-led sessions covering the key topics and modules you'll need to master for the certification exam. You'll get an "expert's eye" on what's truly important for both the exam and real-world application.
  • Practical Insights: Get a feel for actual implementation scenarios and pick up best practices you can use right away.
  • Interactive Learning: Chat directly with SAP experts and get your burning questions answered live.
  • True Confidence: Step into your certification exam feeling completely ready and sure of your abilities.

Seriously, don't let this incredible chance to boost your skills and validate your expertise in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 slip by!

Check out the link below for the full schedule, all the session details, and make sure to register today:

https://learning.sap.com/live-sessions/get-certified-sap-certified-associate-implementation-consultant-sap-sales-cloud-version-2
